column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=4 .
#Text=Discussion

#Text=Considering the properties and biological role of silicon , we evaluated the effects of nutritional supplementation with silicon-enriched spirulina on vascular remodeling induced by hypertension in a SHR rat model .
#Text=Our study showed highly beneficial effects including attenuation of arterial pressure and improvement of vascular reactivity .
#Text=These benefits were associated with reduction in arterial thickness and stiffness caused by the structural remodeling of the aortic wall in SHR .
#Text=They were mainly attributable to Si enrichment .
#Text=Beneficial and safe effects of SpSi supplementation were previously reported in high fat diet-induced models of atherosclerosis in hamsters and metabolic syndrome in rats .
#Text=Improvement of glucose tolerance , insulin resistance , or dyslipidemia were evidenced with both SpSi and Sp supplementation .
#Text=However , only SpSi had beneficial effects on arterial function .
#Text=No toxicity or side effects of SpSi supplement were otherwise observed .

#Text=Increase of arterial stiffness , reduction of arterial compliance , and distensibility marked by fragmentation of elastin are the main consequences of arterial remodeling occurring in hypertension , obesity and aging .
#Text=Vascular remodeling in hypertension is characterized by altered ultrastructure due to reduction in elastin and increase in fibrous tissue .
#Text=Here , we assessed the effect of SpSi on the ultrastructural , mechanical and functional changes characterized in SHR thoracic aorta .

#Text=These modifications consisted of ( i ) arterial wall hypertrophy , ( ii ) fragmentation , linearization , and refolding of elastic fibers , and ( iii ) impaired contractile and vasorelaxant responses .
#Text=These changes typified the degenerative processes leading to the reduction of compliance and distensibility described in hypertension and associated with aging .

#Text=Indeed , in SHR aorta , our results showed enlarged internal diameter and media thickening , increased elastin fragmentation ratio , and lower elastin and collagen levels than in normotensive animals .
#Text=Consequently , contractility was impaired as evidenced by the decreased response and sensitivities to KCl-induced depolarization and PE .
#Text=The vasorelaxant responses to both Ach and SNP were also reduced .

#Text=The enhanced effect of L-NAME on PE-induced contraction suggested that the decrease in the vasodilator capacity of aorta in SHR is due to both the alteration of vascular smooth muscle function and NO bioavailability .
#Text=After three months of supplementation , SpSi substantially corrected and even normalized most of the defects identified in SHR aorta .
#Text=First , aortic hypertrophy was reduced as shown by morphologic analysis .

#Text=Higher level of elastin fiber density and mRNA level were associated to a decrease in MMP-9 expression , suggesting that both enhanced elastin biosynthesis and reduced extracellular matrix contributed to media thinning .
#Text=It is known that hypertensive vascular remodeling involves reorganization and impairment of the extracellular matrix and that MMPs play an important role in this remodeling .
#Text=Second , we observed an improvement of vascular function after SpSi supplementation .
#Text=Contractile and vasorelaxant responses were increased in association with an increased sensitivity to the agonists and antagonists tested and a better NO bioavailability .
#Text=Finally , we found that SHR animals supplemented with SpSi had lower arterial pressure than control SHR .

#Text=Arterial pressure , although significantly reduced , was still higher than normal pressure which may explain the lack of benefit on cardiac parameters in our experimental conditions ( hypertension already established , 3 months of supplementation ) .
#Text=Another interesting result in our study is that supplementation with Sp alone had no effect in SHR suggesting that the benefits observed with SpSi are genuine effects of Si .
#Text=The nutritional essentiality of Si is undeniable .
#Text=This organic element appears as an important structural component of the aortic wall which contributes to elastin and collagen synthesis and stability .
#Text=Data from animal and human studies demonstrated that dietary Si mitigates the risk of cardiovascular diseases .
#Text=Si in drinking water has been inversely correlated with mortality rates due to coronary heart diseases in Finland .
#Text=Reduced damage and thickening of elastic fibers were observed in the aortic wall after silicon supplementation in rabbit models of diet-induced atherosclerosis .
#Text=Moreover , our results are in line with a previous study reporting reduction in systolic arterial pressure after supplementation with soluble silicon in SHR .
#Text=In that study , arterial structure was not investigated and enhancement of intracellular magnesium uptake was evoked as a possible mechanism .
#Text=This is not inconsistent with our findings as Si is supposed to contribute to biological function and affect retention or function of other minerals , such as aluminum or magnesium .
#Text=Various mechanisms are potentially involved in the beneficial effects of Si .
#Text=Here , a major result in our study is that SpSi supplementation reverses elastic fiber degradation which is likely to contribute to the overall benefit .
#Text=The observed regenerative changes of the vascular wall are in line with a Si-related beneficial effect .
#Text=However , quantification of Si level in the aortic tissue is warranted to validate this hypothesis .
